column1: It was my misfortune to have a canoe which was very heavy and consequently sluggish. Because of this we were left behind the rest a little way
column2: there being only four men beside myself in the boat. As the tide fell it left several shoals of sand naked
column4: not knowing the location of the channel amongst such a variety of streams
column5: steered for over two miles into a shoal where we were forced to lie by until high water came. As soon as the tide began to turn
column7: but in spite of all our endeavors
column8: we could neither find nor overtake our companions. At ten o'clock
column10: we stuck an oar in the sands and by turns slept in our canoe
column11: where we were pierced to the skin by the showers that fell in the night.
